importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The outage occurred on Monday, October 20, 2025, at approximately 07:11 GMT, marking the start of a major disruption in AWS services that affected global digital infrastructure.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The AWS outage lasted roughly three hours, from 07:11 to 10:11 GMT, during which 113 services were impacted and users experienced widespread failures across apps, financial platforms, and communication tools.

keyTakeAways: The outage was caused by a technical error in a software update to DynamoDB’s API, which disrupted the Domain Name System (DNS), preventing apps from finding server addresses.
The root cause was not a cyberattack or external threat, but rather human error during a routine update process in AWS’s Virginia data center.
Over 113 AWS services were affected, including major platforms like Snapchat, Pinterest, Apple TV, WhatsApp, Zoom, Roblox, Fortnite, Starbucks, and financial services like Venmo and Coinbase.
The incident highlighted the fragility of modern digital infrastructure, as more than 30% of global cloud computing depends on AWS services.
Despite the widespread impact, AWS engineers resolved the issue quickly, and full operations were restored by 10:11 GMT, though some message processing delays remained.
The outage underscored the critical role of cloud providers like AWS in supporting everyday digital services—from banking and gaming to smart home devices and media platforms.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A major AWS outage on Monday, October 20, 2025, began at 07:11 GMT in one of AWS’s Virginia data centers due to a software update error affecting DynamoDB’s API, which disrupted the Domain Name System (DNS) and caused apps to fail in connecting to servers. This triggered a cascading failure across 113 AWS services, impacting major platforms including Snapchat, Pinterest, WhatsApp, Zoom, Roblox, Fortnite, Venmo, Coinbase, and airlines like Delta and United. The outage also affected consumer services such as Ring, Alexa, and Kindle, as well as media and financial institutions. AWS engineers resolved the issue by 10:11 GMT, though message processing delays remained. Experts confirm this was not a cyberattack but a result of human error, emphasizing the fragility and critical dependence of modern digital life on cloud infrastructure, especially given AWS’s dominance in the global cloud market.
title: What caused Amazon’s AWS outage, and why did so many major apps go offline?
